results.title: It's easier in the country
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chequerboard”.
One of a series of films which looks at the lives of children growing up in different environments. Investigates the idea that the country is the best place to rear children by looking at the lives of two boys from different country backgrounds.

results.title: If we don't go, we'll never know, will we?
results.creator_credit: Russell Toose, Constance Bernstein and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chequerboard”.
The Gordons, with their four children, are migrating from England to australia. This film interviews the Gordons in England and hears of their hopes and dreams. It then spends the first six months in Australia with the family to find out the reality. Reporters: Richard Oxenburgh, Robert Higson.
results.title_for_label: If we don’t go, we’ll never know, will we?

results.title: The Music of Mozart and Haydn
results.creator_credit: Dave Heather, Lexi Godfrey, Klein and EMI/Parlophone
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Castles and concerts”.
Set in the magnificent Haydnsaal of the Schloss Esterhazy in Eisenstadt, Austria and in the historic palaces of Vienna, the Polish Chamber Orchestra conducted by Jerzy Maksymiuk perform three beautiful pieces of chamber music by two of Austria’s greatest classical composers, Mozart and Haydn. Includes images of some of Austria’s picturesque landscapes, artworks and amazing palaces and gardens creating an ambient background to the music of the Orchestra. No commentary.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dave Heather, Lexi Godfrey, Klein and EMI/Parlophone

group_siblings.title: The Academy of St Martin in the Fields at Longleat
group_siblings.creator_credit: Dave Heather, Martin Wyn Griffith, Klein and EMI/Parlophone

results.title: The Academy of St Martin in the Fields at Longleat
results.creator_credit: Dave Heather, Martin Wyn Griffith, Klein and EMI/Parlophone
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Castles and concerts”.
Set in the idyllic historic Longleat House in Wiltshire, England, this program of popular classics is performed by The Academy of St Martin in the Fields conducted by world-renowned Neville Marriner (also artistic director). Neville Marriner introduces the program and provides a commentary on the history of Longleat House and the music of the great composers of the 17th and 18th centuries. Beautiful images of the Longleat Estate, both interior and exterior, accompany the music to provide an atmospheric re-creation of those earlier centuries.

results.title: Charley junior's schooldays
results.creator_credit: Joy Batchelor, John Halas and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Charley”.
Features the Education Act of 1944 and the improvements which may be expected in British education as a result of the Act. Charley Junior, a cartoon character, is eager to know about this future life. A nurse tells him about his school days; the different types of schools he will attend; the increase in education facilities and improvements in method; plans for the training of teachers and the construction of new schools. Voice: Max Adrian.

results.title: Charley's black magic
results.creator_credit: Joy Batchelor, John Halas and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Charley”.
A “Charley” cartoon showing the fundamental importance to the national economy of a plentiful supply of cheap coal. Britain’s source is at present coal but it is not cheap and to remedy the situation there is need for development and re-organisation of mines. The problem of finding enough money for this task will necessitate an increase in the cost of coal, but this situation will be improved as mines become more productive. Voices: Harold Berens, Jack Train.
